channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Fed raises rates by half a percentage point — the biggest hike in two decades — to fight inflation
item.description: Wednesday's rate hike will push the federal funds rate to a range of 0.75%-1%.

item.title: From Estee Lauder to Apple, big companies say China's Covid restrictions are hitting business
item.description: Across industries, companies say China's Covid controls are taking a toll — so much so that some executives warn of more unpredictable performance ahead.

item.title: Dow rallies 900 points as investors bet the Fed can slow inflation without causing a recession
item.description: Stocks surged as investors digested the Federal Reserve's big interest rate decision on Wednesday.

item.title: Hong Kong's Hang Seng rises nearly 2%, mainland China stocks mixed on return from holidays
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Wednesday increased its benchmark interest rate by half a percentage point, in line with market expectations.

item.title: Stock futures fall slightly after Fed induced relief rally
item.description: Stock futures fell slightly after Fed Chair Jerome Powell ruled out the possibility of bigger rate hikes and sent investors into relief rally mode.

item.title: Cramer says Wednesday's relief rally won't vanquish the bears, expects Fed skeptics to remain
item.description: Despite Wall Street's relief rally Wednesday afternoon, CNBC's Jim Cramer said he expects Fed skeptics to remain and continue selling stocks.

item.title: Consumers at breaking point as Fed's inflation battle heats up, investor Peter Boockvar warns
item.description: Investor Peter Boockvar warns the Federal Reserve will not be able to meaningfully contain surging inflation, and there's not much more consumers can withstand.

item.title: This 35-year-old turned her eBay side hustle into a $141 million company: 'Here's the business plan I used'
item.description: In 2014, Tori Gerbig quit her $35,000-per-year job to grow her e-commerce side hustle, Pink Lily. Today, she runs the $141 million company full-time with her husband. The 35-year-old entrepreneur shares the simple five-step business plan she used.

item.title: Miami hosts its first F1 Grand Prix this weekend, and thousands of fans are spending a ton just to be in town
item.description: Miami's top hotels, restaurants and night clubs are offering high-priced packages for race-goers.

item.title: Your kids can learn life lessons from investing and trading in stocks — here's how
item.description: The barrier to entry into the stock market has been progressively lower, especially for young traders. What can kids gain from learning to invest and trade?

item.title: Bitcoin jumps to $40,000 after Fed chair Powell rules out bigger rate hikes
item.description: The cryptocurrency rallied after the central bank raised interest rates by half of a percentage point.

item.title: Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi says U.S. regulator is investigating its $4 billion IPO
item.description: Shortly after Didi went public in the U.S. last year, Chinese regulators opened up a cybersecurity probe into the company.

item.title: A slate of EV automakers report earnings this week and will try to prove they can turn hype into production
item.description: All three stocks are down sharply from highs: Can the companies regain momentum?

item.title: Jim Cramer reveals how he invests his own money—and why he keeps 50% in cash
item.description: Jim Cramer, host of CNBC's stock-trading show "Mad Money," doesn't own individual stocks and keeps half of his portfolio in cash.

item.title: 'Risky' fourth straight rate hike expected from Bank of England as inflation soars
item.description: The Bank of England is expected to opt for a fourth consecutive interest rate hike on Thursday, but economists fear it is entering increasingly choppy waters.

item.title: EU proposes gradual ban on Russian oil in sixth round of sanctions against Moscow
item.description: Russia's unprovoked invasion of Ukraine, and evidence of war crimes, has pushed the EU to take bolder steps on energy sanctions.

item.title: France becomes first big European nation to grant crypto giant Binance regulatory approval
item.description: Changpeng Zhao, Binance's CEO and founder, described France as "very progressive" in adopting crypto.

item.title: The Salton Sea could produce the world's greenest lithium, if new extraction technologies work
item.description: Amid the shrinking, toxic Salton Sea, there's enough lithium to meet the United States' entire projected demand and fuel the electric-vehicle revolution.

item.title: Uber reports surging revenue as drivers return, but posts massive loss on investments
item.description: Uber expects to keep drivers without "significant incremental incentive investments."

item.title: Elon Musk Twitter profile picture change briefly sends token of Bored Ape NFT project soaring
item.description: ApeCoin, the token launched by Bored Ape creators Yuga Labs, surged 19% in an hour following Musk's profile picture change.

item.title: Volkswagen is prolonging its use of coal due to Russian energy 'threat'
item.description: VW chief Herbert Diess' comments were made during an interview with CNBC's Annette Weisbach.

item.title: Elon Musk says businesses and governments may have to pay to use Twitter
item.description: Casual users will continue to be able to use the social media platform for free, the tech billionaire said.

item.title: Buy now, pay later will soon affect your credit score in the UK
item.description: Starting June 1, Klarna will share data on whether Brits paid off a buy now, pay later loan in time to the credit bureaus TransUnion and Experian.

item.title: Elon Musk invited to discuss $44 billion Twitter deal in UK Parliament
item.description: U.K. lawmaker Julian Knight sent Musk a letter requesting that he appear in Parliament to discuss his proposal to buy Twitter.

item.title: Peter Thiel's luxury New Zealand lodge should be rejected, council planner says
item.description: Peter Thiel's proposed lodge in New Zealand hangs in the balance after a senior planner for the local council said the development should be rejected.

item.title: Dave Chappelle attacked on stage by an audience member in Los Angeles, police say
item.description: Stand-up comedian Dave Chappelle on Tuesday was attacked by an audience member during a live performance at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles.

item.title: India's largest-ever IPO will test foreign investor appetite
item.description: Trusted by millions and with enormous reach across the country, the LIC is second only to bank deposits as a haven of savings in India.

item.title: How Ireland lost its chance to become Big Tech’s ‘super regulator’
item.description: With the recently approved Digital Services Act, Ireland will no longer be at the center of the EU's clampdown on Big Tech.

item.title: AMD sales jump 71%, shrugging off concerns about PC slowdown
item.description: AMD reported first-quarter earnings after the bell on Tuesday, beating analyst estimates for earnings and revenue.

item.title: Hong Kong falls 1% as Asia-Pacific stocks decline; Alibaba and Tencent shares drop more than 3%
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is expected to raise interest rates on Wednesday for the second time since 2018.
